title: Bug 49536 - No content returned when accessing a URL with no webapps deployed
description: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server returns a response with HTTP code 200 OK but with no content, instead of returning an HTTP error 404. This behavior is observed when starting Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server returns an HTTP response with code 200 OK but there is no content in the response body.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server should return an HTTP error code 404 indicating that the requested resource was not found.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Download the Tomcat 7 distribution from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat server that does not correspond to any deployed webapp
4. Verify that the server returns an HTTP error code 404 indicating that the requested resource was not found.
